metadata.title: Outbreak of pneumonia of unknown etiology in Wuhan, China: The mystery and the miracle
metadata.author: Hongzhou Lu, Charles W. Stratton, Yi‐Wei Tang
affiliations: Shanghai Public Health Clinical CenterFudan UniversityShanghai China
Department of Pathology, Microbiology, and ImmunologyVanderbilt University Medical CenterNashville Tennessee
metadata.abstract: Since December 2019, a total of 41 cases of pneumonia of unknown serious condition and one patient died. All of the 42 patients so far etiology have been confirmed in Wuhan city, Hubei Province, China. confirmed were from China except one Thailand patient who was a

introduction: Wuhan city is a major transportation hub with a population of more than traveler from Wuhan. Eight patients have been cured of the disease and

11 million people. Most of the patients visited a local fish and wild animal were discharged from the hospital last week. The 2019‐nCoV now have market last month. At a national press conference held today, Dr Jianguo been isolated from multiple patients and appears to be the culprit.

2. Yin Y, Wonderlink RG. MERS, SARS and other coronaviruses as causes of pneumonia. Respirology. 2018;23:130‐137.
3. de Wit E, van Doremalen N, Falzarano D, Munster VJ. SARS and MERS: recent insights into emerging coronaviruses. Nat Rev Microbiol. 2016;14:523‐534.
4. Zumla A, Chan JF, Azhar EI, Hui DS, Yuen KY. Coronaviruses–drug discovery and therapeutic options. Nat Rev Drug Discov. 2016;15:327‐ 47.
5. Fredricks DN, Relman DA. Sequence‐based identification of microbial pathogens: a reconsideration of Koch's postulates. Clin Microbiol Rev. 1996;9:18‐33.
6. Drosten C, Günther S, Preiser W, et al Identification of a novel coronavirus in patients with severe acute respiratory syndrome. N Engl J Med. 2003;348:1967‐1976.
7. Guan Y. Isolation and characterization of viruses related to the SARS coronavirus from animals in southern China. Science. 2003; 302:276‐278.

8. Kan B, Wang M, Jing H, et al Molecular evolution analysis and geographic investigation of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus‐like virus in palm civets at an animal market and on farms. J Virol. 2005;79:11892‐11900.
9. Li W. Bats are natural reservoirs of SARS‐like coronaviruses. Science. 2005;310:676‐9.

10. Cavanagh D. Coronaviridae: a review of coronaviruses and toroviruses. In: Schmidt A, Wolff MH, Weber O, eds. Coronaviruses with Special Emphasis on First Insights Concerning SARS. Switzerland: Birkhauser Verlog Basel; 2005.

summary: Wuhan city is a major transportation hub with a population of more than traveler from Wuhan.
Eight patients have been cured of the disease and
Most of the patients visited a local fish and wild animal were discharged from the hospital last week.
The mystery has not been completely solved yet.

Until there scientific team announced that a new‐type coronavirus, tentatively is a formal published scientific manuscript, the facts can be argued, named by World Health Organization as the 2019‐new coronavirus (2019‐nCoV), had caused this outbreak.[1] regarding causality despite these facts having been officially announced.

The 2019‐nCoV has a different coronavirus‐specific nucleic acid confirm the causal relationship between the new‐type coronavirus sequence from known human coronavirus species, which are similar to some of the beta coronaviruses identified in bats.[2,3] The virus‐specific and the respiratory disease based on classical Koch's postulates or modified ones as suggested by Fredricks and Relman.[5] The viral‐

Nucleic acid sequences were detected in lung fluid, blood and throat swab specific nucleic acids were only discovered in 15 patients, and samples in 15 patients and the virus that was isolated showed a typical successful virus culture was extremely limited to only a few patients.
Ruled out several extremely contagious pathogens including SARS, The episode demonstrates further the need for rapid and which killed hundreds of people more than a decade ago, and MERS.
Most of the patients visited the fish and wild animal market last molecular devices known as CLIA‐waived devices so that these month in Wuhan.
This fish and wild animal market sold live animals devices are gradually becoming available for point of care testing.
The epidemiological similarity between this outbreak and that of SARS in 2002‐20036 is striking.
Wileyonlinelibrary.com/journal/jmv markets[7] and eventually to palm civets.[8] Later bats were identified as animal reservoirs.[9]
Could this novel coronavirus be originated from wild animals?
Coronaviruses are among the spectrum of viruses that cause the common cold as well as more severe respiratory disease— SARS and MERS, which are both zoonoses.
There is no evidence so far that the seafood from the fish and animal market caused 2019‐nCoV‐associated pneumonia.
This fish and animal market has been closed until the epidemiological work determines the animal host of this novel coronavirus.

Introduction: Wuhan city is a major transportation hub with a population of more than traveler from Wuhan.
Eight patients have been cured of the disease and
Most of the patients visited a local fish and wild animal were discharged from the hospital last week.
Results: The mystery has not been completely solved yet.

Until there scientific team announced that a new‐type coronavirus, tentatively is a formal published scientific manuscript, the facts can be argued, named by World Health Organization as the 2019‐new coronavirus (2019‐nCoV), had caused this outbreak.[1] regarding causality despite these facts having been officially announced.

The 2019‐nCoV has a different coronavirus‐specific nucleic acid confirm the causal relationship between the new‐type coronavirus sequence from known human coronavirus species, which are similar to some of the beta coronaviruses identified in bats.[2,3] The virus‐specific and the respiratory disease based on classical Koch's postulates or modified ones as suggested by Fredricks and Relman.[5] The viral‐

Nucleic acid sequences were detected in lung fluid, blood and throat swab specific nucleic acids were only discovered in 15 patients, and samples in 15 patients and the virus that was isolated showed a typical successful virus culture was extremely limited to only a few patients.
Ruled out several extremely contagious pathogens including SARS, The episode demonstrates further the need for rapid and which killed hundreds of people more than a decade ago, and MERS.
Most of the patients visited the fish and wild animal market last molecular devices known as CLIA‐waived devices so that these month in Wuhan.
This fish and wild animal market sold live animals devices are gradually becoming available for point of care testing.
The epidemiological similarity between this outbreak and that of SARS in 2002‐20036 is striking.
Wileyonlinelibrary.com/journal/jmv markets[7] and eventually to palm civets.[8] Later bats were identified as animal reservoirs.[9]
Could this novel coronavirus be originated from wild animals?
Conclusion: Coronaviruses are among the spectrum of viruses that cause the common cold as well as more severe respiratory disease— SARS and MERS, which are both zoonoses.
There is no evidence so far that the seafood from the fish and animal market caused 2019‐nCoV‐associated pneumonia.
This fish and animal market has been closed until the epidemiological work determines the animal host of this novel coronavirus.
